intro: Adinandra leytensis, commonly known as the Leyte adinandra, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small white flowers. It typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
